summary: This is an FBI 302 interview report of a BOP employee conducted on August 28, 2019, regarding observations of unusual document shredding at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York following Jeffrey Epstein's death. The employee reported seeing an inmate with large amounts of shredded paper and hearing references to a BOP After Action team and a white man with a Southern accent involved in the shredding.

keyFacts: A BOP officer reported observing an inmate with an unusually large amount of shredded paper at MCC shortly after Jeffrey Epstein's death.

The inmate reportedly stated 'They are shredding everything back there' and mentioned a white man with a Southern accent involved, who the officer surmised was part of the BOP After Action team investigating Epstein's suicide.
The officer reported this incident to the FBI, leading to a formal interview with the FBI and DOJ-OIG.
A third-hand account mentioned that an officer had told the former MCC warden that Epstein should have been confined in the 10 South wing.
The document is an FBI 302 report, indicating an official investigation into potential evidence destruction related to the Epstein case.
